techmeme.title: Apple is selling a $120 Vision Pro comfort strap with modular counterweights, made by sleep apnea device maker ResMed, to address complaints about extended wear (Zac Hall/9to5Mac)
Threads is testing collections of profiles to follow, curated by a "handful of Threads community leaders", built around topics like fashion, food, and books (Jay Peters/The Verge)
Microsoft's new version of Recall appears to still capture sensitive data like credit card numbers, even with the "sensitive information" filter enabled (Avram Piltch/Tom's Hardware)
A survey of US teens aged 13 to 17 shows 73% use YouTube daily, 57% use TikTok daily, 50% use Instagram, and 20% use Facebook; 17% use X, down from 23% in 2022 (Pew Research Center)
Sources: in the past year, US chip companies have lobbied the US government against a China sales ban, citing billions in lost revenue, shocking US officials (Ana Swanson/New York Times)
